cosm Package¶

control Module¶

Created on Nov 6, 2012

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.outputs.cosm.control.COSMControl[source]¶

Bases: lib.base.Base

COSMControl starts the COSM processing to send data to COSM at the following URL:

https://cosm.com/

cosm = None¶
cosmOutputThread = None¶
logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level. This needs to be added to house_monitoring_logging.conf

queue = None¶
startCOSM(options)[source]¶

Start the COSM processing.

This consists of three parts:

#. Start the COSMQueue which used Queue, a thread safe queue for communcating between threads.

  1. Start the COSMOutputThread which talks to the COSM server. This is a slow process.

#. Start the COSMOutputProcessing object which takes massages sent to COSM on the main thread and sends them to the COSM thread.

outputStep Module¶

Created on 2012-11-06

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.outputs.cosm.outputStep.COSMOutputStep(queue)[source]¶

Bases: steps.abc_step.abcStep

This object should be started with with the COSM thread and hang around forever.

logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level.

queue = None¶

A Queue for communicating between threads.

step(value, data={}, listeners=[])[source]¶

This function receives data that will be sent to COSM and forwards it to the COSM output processing thread.

This function will compare the value with the previous value and if they are different send the data to the next listener else don’t send the data along.

Parameters:
  • value (boolean, int or float) – The number to add to the list of numbers.
  • data –

    a dictionary containing more information about the value. Data can be added to this as needed. Here is a list of values that will be in the data dictionary:

    1 date: time received: time when value was received. 2. units: units of the number 3. “”name:** name assigned to the value

  • listeners – a list of the subscribed routines to send the data to
Returns:

value, data, listeners
Return type:

float, dict, listeners
Raises :

ValueError, KeyError
topic_name[source]¶

The topic name to which this routine subscribes.

outputthread Module¶

Created on Oct 2, 2012

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.outputs.cosm.outputthread.COSMOutputThread(queue, options, send=None, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: lib.base.Base, threading.Thread

This thread will remove the data off the cosm queue and send it to the COSM web site.

forever = True¶
logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level. This needs to be added to house_monitoring_logging.conf

process()[source]¶

This function does the following:

  1. Wait on data from the queue.
  2. Remove data from previous send.
  3. Unpack data from received packet
  4. send data to COSM_send
run()[source]¶

The COSM thread will loop forever calling process.

Create a location field that will be sent it the json object sent to COSM. The following data will be taken from the configuration file.

report_data(json, data, http=None)[source]¶

reportData - Sends the json object to the COSMSend web site

if the options.in_test_mode is NOT set then don’t send data to COSM web site. The options.in_test_mode is set with the command line argument –test

the httplib2 debuglevel is set with the command line argument –http N where N is a positive integer.

Parameters:
  • json – the current value
  • data – the data that is pasted between steps
Returns:

None
Raises :

None
